error.user.no_sys_ident: This system user was not found
error.user.not_found: This TGS user was not found
error.group.not_found: The requested group cannot be found.
error.group.not_empty: The requested group cannot be deleted as it contains users.
error.admin.rate: The server has exceeded github's rate limiting. Please try again later.
error.admin.error: The server has ran into an error while using github's API.

error.job.not_found: The specified job could not be found

error.transfer.not_available: Unable to transfer file as it is no longer or never was valid
error.transfer.upload_failed: An error occured while uploading a file
error.no_db_entity: The database entity for the requested instance could not be retrieved. The instance was likely detached
error.no_apipath: No API path set, set an API path on the configuration page.
generic.debugwarn: Be careful to censor out any credentials or tokens when copying errors!

generic.wip.desc: The TGS webpanel is still a work in progress. The feature you are trying to use is not yet available. Until it becomes available, please use the TGS desktop client at

view.setup.navigationblock: Navigation has been disabled for the duration of the setup.
view.setup.title: Step By Step Setup Wizard
view.setup.quitconfirm: Are you sure you want to exit the setup? You will not be able to return.
view.setup.step.1: Step 1. Create yourself a user account
view.setup.step.2: Step 2. Login using your new user account
view.setup.step.3: Step 3. Disable the default Admin account
view.admin.reboot.modal.title: Confirmation
view.admin.reboot.modal.body: Are you sure you wish to restart TGS?
view.admin.update.wait: Please take the time to read the release notes before proceeding
view.user.list.cantlist: This user does not have the permission to list users, only the current user is listed/editable.
view.user.edit.cantedit: This user does not have the permission to edit users.
view.user.passwd.title: Editing password for
view.instanceedit.title: Editing Instance {instancename}({instanceid})
view.instance.create.title: New Instance
view.instance.create.name: Name
view.instance.list.title: Instance List
view.instance.configmode.2: Authorized users can read/write using their system user
view.instance.jobs.title: Job list
view.instance.byond.current_and_list_den: This user does not have the permission to access information about BYOND versions
view.instance.byond.list_denied: This user does not have the permission to list all installed BYOND versions
view.instance.byond.current_denied: This user does not have the permission to see the active BYOND version
view.instance.server.no_metadata: You do not have the permission to list Dream Daemon settings for this instance, only editable fields will be shown. Said fields will only contain default values.
view.instance.server.no_metadata_and_no_: You do not have the permission to list or edit Dream Daemon settings for this instance.
view.instance.server.no_metadata_actions: You do not have permission to fetch the status of the server, some actions may not work depending on the state of the server.
view.instance.server.no_metadata_gracefu: You do not have permission to fetch the current graceful action.
view.instance.server.no_graceful: You do not have permission to get or set the current graceful action.
view.instance.server.no_actions: You do not have permission to commit any actions.
view.instance.graceful.desc: This action will be applied the next time the server restarts
view.instance.repo.canthookclone: Unable to find clone job, refresh page when clone is complete. Please report this!
view.instance.repo.testmerges.badprovide: Guided test merges are only supported on github
view.instance.repo.info.name: Repository Name
view.instance.repo.tm.modal.title: Add or Update Testmerge
view.instance.repo.tm.modal.label: Select Commit
view.instance.repo.tm.modal.tip: Tip: When clicking the add or update button, hold shift to testmerge the latest commit bypassing this popup!
view.instance.repo.pending.title: Pending Changes
view.instance.repo.update.desc: This option will add new changes from the remote repository to the local
view.instance.repo.reset.desc: This option will reset the repository to the tracked origin, updating the repository and clearing any test merged PRs
view.instance.repo.manual.desc: Use this box to manually test merge a PR by entering its number and clicking add pr
perms.admin.writeusers.desc: Ability to edit users, if View Users is granted, all users can be edited, otherwise, only the current user can be edited
perms.admin.changeversion.desc: Abilty to update TGS to a newer version
perms.admin.editownpassword.desc: Ability to change their own password
perms.admin.downloadlogs.desc: Ability to view and download all TGS logs
perms.admin.editownoauthconnections.desc: Ability to edit their own identity providers(oauth)
perms.instance.read.desc: Ability to list and view instances the user is allowed access to. WARNING: Users who know the instance ID can still use the API to edit it using other permissions even if they lack this one.
perms.instance.create.warning: The current user is not permitted to create instances
perms.instance.relocate.desc: Ablity to change the location of an instance on the file system
perms.instance.setonline.desc: Ability to set an instance as online or offline
perms.instance.list.desc: Ability to list and view all instances
perms.instance.setconfiguration.desc: Ability to set an instance's static file editing mode
perms.instance.setautoupdate.desc: Ability to set an instance's interval for automatic code updates
perms.instance.setchatbotlimit.desc: Ability to change an instance's maximum amounts of bots
perms.instance.grantpermissions.desc: Ability to grant themselves all permissions on any instance
perms.group.warning: This user is linked to the "{group}" group. Any change to the permissions will be applied to the group.
perms.group.delete.warning: This group contains more than 0 users. Remove all users before deleting the group.
perms.group.cantlist: You lack the permission to list all users. You need it to be able to list all groups
config.githubtoken.desc: You can supply a private authorization token for github to bypass some rate limiting on the github API.
config.apipath.desc: Sets the API client server's path.
config.jobpollinactive.desc: After how many seconds should we check for new jobs if we dont have any active jobs
config.jobpollactive.desc: After how many seconds should we check for new jobs if we know about a job
config.jobswidgetdisplay.desc: Display mode for the instance jobs widget
config.instanceprobetimer.desc: After how many seconds should we update the list of instances
config.itemsperpage.desc: This allows you to configure the amount of items shown at once in lists. Note that not all lists support this option yet.
config.instanceeditsidebar.desc: This controls how the left sidebar menu acts in the instance edit page.
config.showjson.desc: Most pages will display the underlying json data if enabled.
config.manualpr: Show manual PR entry on repository page
config.manualpr.desc: Controls whether or not an input box is displayed to manually testmerge a pr based on its PR number. This option is ignored and the manual PR entry box is always displayed when using a repository hosted on GitLab.
fields.instance.name: Instance Name
fields.instance.autoupdate: Autoupdate Interval in minutes (0 to disable)
fields.instance.filemode.HostWrite: Logged in users can edit any file.
fields.instance.filemode.SystemIdentityW: Users using a system identity can edit files their user has access to.
fields.instance.repository.checkoutsha.d: SHA of the commit to checkout
fields.instance.repository.reference.des: Set this to the branch, commit or tag you wish to track
fields.instance.repository.accessUser.de: These credentials will be used when cloning the repository or performing authenticated actions
fields.instance.repository.accessToken.d: For github, this will be a PAT(Private Authentication Token), for other providers, this will be a password
fields.instance.repository.pushTestMerge: This will push commits created by test merges to a temporary branch on the remote. Requires access credentials.
fields.instance.repository.showTestMerge: Show test merge commiters in public metadata
Shows who test merged a PR. This only applies to future commits.
fields.instance.repository.autoUpdatesKe: Preserve test merges when auto updating
If enabled, auto updates may fail if a merge conflict occurs.
fields.instance.repository.autoUpdatesSy: Push new commits to origin during auto-update
Used for example, with changelog scripts depending on the setup
fields.instance.repository.postTestMerge: Post comment when test merge is deployed
This will post a github comment each time a test merge is deployed or updated
fields.instance.repository.updateSubmodu: Submodules will be updated automatically when resetting, checking out or adding a test merge. This is not recursive
warning.screensize: The TGS webpanel does not guarentee support for viewports with a width of under 992px.
